content.description: Begin on great jugs to first bolt. Make a reach move on a one or two finger sloping crimp to better holds above. The crux comes just before the second bolt and involves a desperate long reach to an alright hold. If you were to fall here, you may hit the ground, so be cautious. The climbing eases up and the route ends on the same anchors as Playin' Hookey.    Keep in mind that the second bolt is not visible from the ground and is just above the crux.
content.location: This is the Fourth bolted line you will see as you walk along the base of Trundle Bluff.

content.description: Crux between first and second bolt.
content.location: This is the 5th route from the right.

climbs.name: Pick Pocket
climbs.fa: Ken Duncan back in the day.

content.description: Crux is between the 3rd and 4th bolt.  Not a problem for you if you have very good feet or a longer than average wing-span.  Until this move it's a casual 5.8 route.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a set of chains.
content.location: Traverse the buff until you've almost reached the end.  The old truck (drive-in) will be on your left between you and the river.  This is approximately the third route from the end of the wall.  You'll see the first bolt at about the 10 foot mark.

content.description: Climb thin face holds making a few tenuous moves up to a large rotten chunk of rock, and traverse right around the roof, eventually leading to the anchors. Bring long draws for this one as to avoid some serious rope drag after the traverse,
content.location: This route is left of Got Time For a Quickie, and is the third  bolted line you see walking along the base of Trundle Bluff.

content.description: Begin on a horizontal dike-like feature that provides good jugs to the first bolt. Move up and make long easy reaches from pocket to pocket with a few mantles through-out.
content.location: This routes is to the left of Community Service. The second bolted line you see walking along the base of Trundle Bluff

content.description: A fun little route that everyone can enjoy.  It's easy and well protected which makes it fun for the whole family.  It's just to the left of Chocolate Chip Cookie.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a set of chains at the top.
content.location: Just to the left of Chocolate Chip Cookie which is on the second section of the bluff.  Continue traversing the wall past the first section until you come to a little rise where there is a red rope tied in.  Follow the rope up and to the left and you'll see the second section of the crag.  This section has many good routes for beginner climbers.

content.description: The crux is lower in the route.
content.location: The furthest route on the right side of the crag.

content.description: In Columbia Missouri, part of Capen Park along the Hinkson Creek that is developed for sport climbing.
